query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 «Poscia che Costantin l’aquila volse 2 contr’ al corso del ciel, ch’ella seguio 3 dietro a l’antico che Lavina tolse,
query.result: 1 After Constantine turned the eagle 2 against the course of the heavens, which it had followed 3 behind the ancient one who took Lavinia,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 cento e cent’ anni e più l’uccel di Dio 5 ne lo stremo d’Europa si ritenne, 6 vicino a’ monti de’ quai prima uscìo;

Please translate each line literally into English.
7 e sotto l’ombra de le sacre penne 8 governò ’l mondo lì di mano in mano, 9 e, sì cangiando, in su la mia pervenne.
query.result: 7 and under the shadow of its sacred wings 8 it governed the world there from hand to hand, 9 and, thus changing, it came into my possession.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Cesare fui e son Iustinïano, 11 che, per voler del primo amor ch’i’ sento, 12 d’entro le leggi trassi il troppo e ’l vano.
query.result: 10 I was Caesar and I am Justinian, 11 who, through the will of the first love that I feel, 12 removed the superfluous and the vain from within the laws.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 E prima ch’io a l’ovra fossi attento, 14 una natura in Cristo esser, non piùe, 15 credea, e di tal fede era contento;

Please translate each line literally into English.
16 ma ’l benedetto Agapito, che fue 17 sommo pastore, a la fede sincera 18 mi dirizzò con le parole sue.
query.result: 16 but the blessed Agapetus, who was 17 the supreme shepherd, directed me to the true faith 18 with his words.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Io li credetti; e ciò che ’n sua fede era, 20 vegg’ io or chiaro sì, come tu vedi 21 ogni contradizione e falsa e vera.
query.result: 19 I believed him; and that which was in his faith, 20 I see now as clearly as you see 21 every contradiction, both false and true.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Tosto che con la Chiesa mossi i piedi, 23 a Dio per grazia piacque di spirarmi 24 l’alto lavoro, e tutto ’n lui mi diedi;

Please translate each line literally into English.
25 e al mio Belisar commendai l’armi, 26 cui la destra del ciel fu sì congiunta, 27 che segno fu ch’i’ dovessi posarmi.
query.result: 25 and I entrusted my armies to my Belisarius, 26 to whom the right hand of heaven was so joined, 27 that it was a sign that I should rest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Or qui a la question prima s’appunta 29 la mia risposta; ma sua condizione 30 mi stringe a seguitare alcuna giunta,
query.result: 28 Now here the first question comes to a head 29 my response; but his condition 30 binds me to follow some addition,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 perché tu veggi con quanta ragione 32 si move contr’ al sacrosanto segno 33 e chi ’l s’appropria e chi a lui s’oppone.
query.result: 31 so that you may see with how much justification 32 one moves against the sacrosanct sign, 33 and both he who appropriates it for himself and he who opposes it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Vedi quanta virtù l’ha fatto degno 35 di reverenza; e cominciò da l’ora 36 che Pallante morì per darli regno.
query.result: 34 See how much virtue has made it worthy 35 of reverence; and it began from the hour 36 that Pallas died to give it dominion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Tu sai ch’el fece in Alba sua dimora 38 per trecento anni e oltre, infino al fine 39 che i tre a’ tre pugnar per lui ancora.
query.result: 37 You know that it made its dwelling in Alba 38 for three hundred years and more, until the time 39 when the three fought against the three for it again.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 E sai ch’el fé dal mal de le Sabine 41 al dolor di Lucrezia in sette regi, 42 vincendo intorno le genti vicine.
query.result: 40 And you know that it led it from the evil of the Sabine women 41 to the sorrow of Lucretia under seven kings, 42 conquering the neighboring peoples all around.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Sai quel ch’el fé portato da li egregi 44 Romani incontro a Brenno, incontro a Pirro, 45 incontro a li altri principi e collegi;

Please translate each line literally into English.
46 onde Torquato e Quinzio, che dal cirro 47 negletto fu nomato, i Deci e ’ Fabi 48 ebber la fama che volontier mirro.
query.result: 46 whence Torquatus and Quinctius, who was surnamed Cincinnatus 47 from his neglected hair, the Decii and the Fabii 48 had the fame that I gladly mirror myself in.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Esso atterrò l’orgoglio de li Aràbi 50 che di retro ad Anibale passaro 51 l’alpestre rocce, Po, di che tu labi.
query.result: 49 It struck down the pride of the Arabs 50 who, following Hannibal, crossed 51 the Alpine rocks, Po, from which you flow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Sott’ esso giovanetti trïunfaro 53 Scipïone e Pompeo; e a quel colle 54 sotto ’l qual tu nascesti parve amaro.
query.result: 52 Under it young Scipio and Pompey triumphed, 53 and to that hill 54 beneath which you were born it seemed bitter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Poi, presso al tempo che tutto ’l ciel volle 56 redur lo mondo a suo modo sereno, 57 Cesare per voler di Roma il tolle.
query.result: 55 Then, near the time when all of heaven wished 56 to restore the world to its tranquil state, 57 Caesar took it by the will of Rome.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 E quel che fé da Varo infino a Reno, 59 Isara vide ed Era e vide Senna 60 e ogne valle onde Rodano è pieno.
query.result: 58 And what it did from the Var to the Rhine, 59 the Isère saw and the Herault and the Seine saw 60 and every valley from which the Rhone is full.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Quel che fé poi ch’elli uscì di Ravenna 62 e saltò Rubicon, fu di tal volo, 63 che nol seguiteria lingua né penna.
query.result: 61 What it did after it left Ravenna 62 and crossed the Rubicon was of such a flight 63 that neither tongue nor pen could follow it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Inver’ la Spagna rivolse lo stuolo, 65 poi ver’ Durazzo, e Farsalia percosse 66 sì ch’al Nil caldo si sentì del duolo.
query.result: 64 He turned his army toward Spain, 65 then toward Dyrrhachium, and struck Pharsalus 66 so that the Nile felt the heat of the grief.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Antandro e Simeonta, onde si mosse, 68 rivide e là dov’ Ettore si cuba; 69 e mal per Tolomeo poscia si scosse.

Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Da indi scese folgorando a Iuba; 71 onde si volse nel vostro occidente, 72 ove sentia la pompeana tuba.

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Di quel che fé col baiulo seguente, 74 Bruto con Cassio ne l’inferno latra, 75 e Modena e Perugia fu dolente.
query.result: 73 Of what he did with the following standard-bearer, 74 Brutus with Cassius barks in Hell, 75 and Modena and Perugia were sorrowful.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Piangene ancor la trista Cleopatra, 77 che, fuggendoli innanzi, dal colubro 78 la morte prese subitana e atra.
query.result: 76 The sad Cleopatra still weeps, 77 who, fleeing before him, from the asp 78 took sudden and black death.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Con costui corse infino al lito rubro; 80 con costui puose il mondo in tanta pace, 81 che fu serrato a Giano il suo delubro.

Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Ma ciò che ’l segno che parlar mi face 83 fatto avea prima e poi era fatturo 84 per lo regno mortal ch’a lui soggiace,
query.result: 82 But what the standard that makes me speak 83 had done before and would do afterwards 84 for the mortal realm that is subject to him,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 diventa in apparenza poco e scuro, 86 se in mano al terzo Cesare si mira 87 con occhio chiaro e con affetto puro;

Please translate each line literally into English.
88 ché la viva giustizia che mi spira, 89 li concedette, in mano a quel ch’i’ dico, 90 gloria di far vendetta a la sua ira.
query.result: 88 for the living justice that inspires me 89 granted them, at the hands of the one I speak of, 90 the glory of avenging his wrath.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Or qui t’ammira in ciò ch’io ti replìco: 92 poscia con Tito a far vendetta corse 93 de la vendetta del peccato antico.
query.result: 91 Now here marvel at what I reply to you: 92 afterwards with Titus he went to take vengeance 93 for the vengeance of the ancient sin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 E quando il dente longobardo morse 95 la Santa Chiesa, sotto le sue ali 96 Carlo Magno, vincendo, la soccorse.
query.result: 94 And when the Lombard tooth bit 95 the Holy Church, under his wings 96 Charlemagne, conquering, came to her aid.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Omai puoi giudicar di quei cotali 98 ch’io accusai di sopra e di lor falli, 99 che son cagion di tutti vostri mali.
query.result: 97 Now you can judge those 98 whom I accused above and their faults, 99 which are the cause of all your troubles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 L’uno al pubblico segno i gigli gialli 101 oppone, e l’altro appropria quello a parte, 102 sì ch’è forte a veder chi più si falli.
query.result: 100 One opposes the yellow lilies to the public standard, 101 and the other appropriates it for his party, 102 so that it is hard to see who sins more.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Faccian li Ghibellin, faccian lor arte 104 sott’ altro segno, ché mal segue quello 105 sempre chi la giustizia e lui diparte;

Please translate each line literally into English.
106 e non l’abbatta esto Carlo novello 107 coi Guelfi suoi, ma tema de li artigli 108 ch’a più alto leon trasser lo vello.
query.result: 106 and let not this new Charles strike it down 107 with his Guelphs, but let him fear the claws 108 that tore the hide from a prouder lion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Molte fïate già pianser li figli 110 per la colpa del padre, e non si creda 111 che Dio trasmuti l’armi per suoi gigli!
query.result: 109 Many times have the sons wept 110 for the fault of the father, and let it not be believed 111 that God changes his arms for their lilies!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Questa picciola stella si correda 113 d’i buoni spirti che son stati attivi 114 perché onore e fama li succeda:
query.result: 112 This little star is adorned 113 with the good spirits who were active 114 so that honor and fame might follow them:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 e quando li disiri poggian quivi, 116 sì disvïando, pur convien che i raggi 117 del vero amore in sù poggin men vivi.
query.result: 115 and when desires mount up here, 116 thus straying, it is necessary that the rays 117 of true love mount up less lively.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Ma nel commensurar d’i nostri gaggi 119 col merto è parte di nostra letizia, 120 perché non li vedem minor né maggi.
query.result: 118 But in the measuring of our wages 119 with our merit is part of our joy, 120 because we see them neither less nor greater.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Quindi addolcisce la viva giustizia 122 in noi l’affetto sì, che non si puote 123 torcer già mai ad alcuna nequizia.
query.result: 121 Therefore the living justice sweetens 122 the affection in us so, that it cannot 123 ever be twisted to any wickedness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Diverse voci fanno dolci note; 125 così diversi scanni in nostra vita 126 rendon dolce armonia tra queste rote.

Please translate each line literally into English.
127 E dentro a la presente margarita 128 luce la luce di Romeo, di cui 129 fu l’ovra grande e bella mal gradita.
query.result: 127 And within the present pearl 128 shines the light of Romeo, whose 129 great and beautiful work was ill-rewarded.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Ma i Provenzai che fecer contra lui 131 non hanno riso; e però mal cammina 132 qual si fa danno del ben fare altrui.
query.result: 130 But the Provençals who acted against him 131 have not laughed; and therefore he walks ill 132 who harms himself by doing good to others.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Quattro figlie ebbe, e ciascuna reina, 134 Ramondo Beringhiere, e ciò li fece 135 Romeo, persona umìle e peregrina.
query.result: 133 Four daughters he had, and each a queen, 134 Raymond Berenger, and this made for him 135 Romeo, a humble and foreign man.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 E poi il mosser le parole biece 137 a dimandar ragione a questo giusto, 138 che li assegnò sette e cinque per diece,
query.result: 136 And then the wicked words moved him 137 to demand justice from this just man, 138 who assigned him seven and five for ten,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 indi partissi povero e vetusto; 140 e se ’l mondo sapesse il cor ch’elli ebbe 141 mendicando sua vita a frusto a frusto,

Please translate each line literally into English.
142 assai lo loda, e più lo loderebbe».
query.result: 142 it would praise him greatly, and would praise him even more».
